title: Man found guilty of sex trafficking child in mother’s Dorchester basement
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Crime Tramonte Jamier Queen, 26, arranged with sex buyers for the victims to perform sex acts in his mother’s basement in Dorchester and in Rhode Island hotels.

A Boston man was found guilty in federal court of sex trafficking a child after he was accused of prostituting a 16-year-old girl in the basement of his mother’s Dorchester home and across state lines to Rhode Island hotels, prosecutors said.

Tramonte Jamier Queen, 26, was convicted of one count of sex trafficking a child and one count of transportation of a minor with intent to engage in criminal sexual activity, US Attorney Leah Foley’s office announced.

title: Armed individual enters Canton police station, threatens officers during mental health crisis, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News The unnamed individual is a 36 year-old Canton resident.
A person experiencing a mental health crisis walked into the police station in Canton on Wednesday showing what appeared to be a handgun, Canton police said.
Officers quickly attempted to de-escalate the situation by speaking to the individual through the lobby door, but the 36-year-old Canton resident continued the threats, police said.

title: N.H. nursing assistant faces additional child sex abuse charges after recent arrests
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The 25-year-old hospital employee was charged last month with sexually assaulting a child, according to police.
A nursing assistant at a New Hampshire hospital who was arrested last month for allegedly sexually assaulting a child is now facing several additional charges related to another child.
Alexander Colbath, 25, of Manchester, N.

title: Man charged with murder after Manchester, N.H. stabbing
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Crime Mark Delisle was arrested and charged with second-degree murder after he was spotted by an officer on detail, Police Chief Peter Marr said.
A man has been charged with murder in New Hampshire after a Londonderry man was found stabbed to death in Manchester earlier this week, officials said.

Mark Delisle, 32, is facing one count of second-degree murder and is expected to be arraigned in the Ninth Circuit Court in Manchester Thursday, New Hampshire Attorney General John Formella’s office announced.

title: What the Patriots are saying about facing Jarrett Stidham
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "We're going to watch the tape on him and figure out what he likes to do.

They didn't like him over Bo [Nix]" Jarrett Stidham AP Photo/Jack Dempsey FOXBOROUGH – Jarrett Stidham is a former Patriots quarterback who is set to start the AFC championship against his former team after Bo Nix broke a bone in his ankle during Denver’s win against Buffalo last Saturday.
Patriots offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels certainly knows about Stidham’s game, having coaching him in New England and Las Vegas.

title: R.I. man arrested after hit-and-run crash that injured Salem police officer
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The officer was injured while he and another officer were conducting a narcotics investigation in Salem, police said.
A Rhode Island man was arrested Wednesday after he allegedly struck and injured a Salem police officer with his vehicle and fled the scene.
Lucas David Fulcar-Bautista, 33, of Coventry, R.
